cw: sex, long anecdote about sex

Okay so about a year ago I was hooking up with someone and she asked me what I liked (during sex) and I was FLOORED because nobody had ever asked me that before! I told her that she was the first person to ever ask me that question and she’s all like “wow what sorts of terrible people have you dated?” At the time I was like “yeah, every single other person has been a total piece of shit!” BUT THAT’S NOT TRUE. Since then, I’ve asked every person I’ve hooked up what they liked and (like me) they’ve all been super surprised by the question! Like, really honestly surprised! Which is kind of sad, you know? Lots of people haven’t had an answer right away (because, you know, we’re all still trying to figure all of this shit out) but we always make some progress and talk about it which is always awkward but kind of nice? Talking about sex is SO stigmatized and there’s all of this pressure to be good at it ALL THE TIME and I feel like it’s so easy to dismiss the fact that there’s a learning process attached to the whole thing. 

Ask people what they like! If they don’t know, try some stuff and check in to see what feels good! Not everyone likes the same kinky stuff and people’s interests change so check in regularly! I’m sure there are groups on campus that talk about this stuff so imma try to seek them out and it’d be cool if other people went too! All the admiration in the world for the girl who first asked me what I was into-and for everyone else who’s checking in with their partners and working to make these conversations become commonplace. Thank y’all for coming to my Ted talk:)

I have admired my fair share of folks in my time here at Brown - though BBA posts and in the quiet simple sighing of my heart. A few days ago, I was standing in line when a guy I've had a crush on since taking a class together freshman year joined the line behind me with a friend. Cue blushing, pretending to be busy with something else so he wouldn't see. And in the minutes he stood behind me, the image I had of him as smart and put together and compassionate disintegrated as I overheard him being crude and flippant with his friend.

Since then, as I've walked around campus and seen other long-time crushes, I've realized that I don't really know them. Today I saw a woman from debate that I've thought is breathtakingly beautiful for so long and realized she has a whole life that exists very well without me. I trust that there are tons of wonderful people here at Brown (there are!), but the expected last hurrah of pursing the people you haven't mustered the courage to ask out yet is no longer as appealing (and I have hooked up and dated and asked folks out and been rejected in my time at Brown). Does anyone else feel the same? Are we not better off waiting until we settle in a new location and dating without preconceptions there?

I know it's been weeks since we last were together, but seeing you still hurts me. It haunts me that you never knew how much I cared about you. It haunts me that you maybe never knew that I cared about you at all. And it haunts me knowing that you might never have actually cared about me. I miss playing with your fingers, tracing your face, I miss that time we used to look into each other's eyes and forget about the world. You have new fingers now, a new face, and new eyes to lose yourself in. And I'm trying to let my own fingers, my own face, and my own eyes be enough for me right now. But still you haunt me.

Adulthood is hard. Harder than CS 19. Heck, even harder than Orgo. It’s almost as hard as an unfrosted Ratty bagel. And that's what makes each and everyone reading this so special- congratulations, you made it. We admire you. Keep being you. 

But still. Adulthood is hard.

Part of what makes adulthood so hard is managing one’s finances. 

Enter Credit Karma. 

We’re a consumer technology company that’s working to make financial progress for all, by providing free access to credit scores and using predictive, data-driven insights to connect our members -- all 85 million of them -- with the financial products that best meet their needs. We’re looking for Software Engineering and Product Management interns to join our mission this summer. 

Join us for dinner on 4/1 at 6:30 pm (CIT 101) if you’d like to learn more about:
* Your credit score. What is it and why should you care?
* A 2015 CS Brown Alum’s experience working at tech giant company vs a hypergrowth Silicon Valley startup (Credit Karma)
* How your eclectic Brown education can set you up for an interdisciplinary leadership role such as Product Management
* How various technologies -- Node, React, Scala, Spark, Tensorflow and more -- come together to provide data driven and delightful experiences at scale. 
* Software and Product Management internship opportunities. More details: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oMmwLh5_bAgTh0_cY3uGpv8npIM63TP1/view?usp=sharing

If you’re interested in attending, please fill in this form by 3/23: https://goo.gl/forms/4swLayBtTlQicENz1
Spots are limited to the first 20 who RSVP.

Looking forward to seeing you all!
Ria, Class of 2015

Katherine Beggs, speak to me. Yes, please. Speak to me. I have seen you walk through the streets of College Hill, under the warm, assuaging light that envelops the city. When I see you, I do not know if I am living or dead. I look onward, outward, so as to control myself from the brightness of your being. Such intensity. Such beauty. And if I were to ask you of your current relationship status, how would you respond? Single? Ready to mingle? Your waving hair follows the pattern of the lilacs in the windy meadow. Your eyes possess an incendiary glow from the beaming light that shines on all, but most truly on you. I imagine that if one were to look closely, with passionate intent, they would see an iridescence so unknowing it would move them to a loving stage. Katherine Beggs, I cannot tell you much of myself, but I can say with utmost sincerity and truth: that you are a like a nymph. Certainly you have the voice of a nymph, but your aura is like that of a nymph: majestic and transcendent. So I ask you this: are you single? Single for someone like me?

I don’t know what to call this feeling. That spark of joy when I randomly see you at lunch. Feeling surprised running into you at your favorite spots, even when I should expect to see you there. The rush of blood to my head when I see your name on a text message. I have an idea of what “love” or “liking” someone is supposed to be, and I feel like this isn’t it. For all intents and purposes, I don’t think I know you enough, that I’m close enough to you to classify this feeling that way. It’s not jealousy I feel seeing you getting along with others, but jealousy-adjacent? I want to talk to you, to get to know you, to spend time with you, too. Does that have to be romantic? Is it just a deeper friendship that I’m looking for? It feels like more than that. What do I call this? How do I tell you what’s on my mind when I barely know myself? If it isn’t anything that deep, I don’t want to treat it like it is, but I’m just not sure. I’m not sure.

Ivy Day is March 28th this year, and the majority of other decisions will come out April 1st, so let folks know prior that you're excited for them and will be proud no matter what the outcome because of the effort they've put into the process. To all the black womxn on this campus:
•You deserve respect as much as everyone else 
•You deserve to be seen as much as everyone else 
•You deserve to be heard as much as everyone else 
•You deserve joy as much as everyone else 
•You deserve to be loved as much as everyone else
•You are just as beautiful as everyone else
•You deserve to be HERE as much as everyone else 

*You are allowed to be tired
*You are allowed to be mad
*You are allowed to have fun
*You are allowed to be imperfect
*You are allowed to go through changes
*You are allowed to feel
*You are allowed to be done 

We have the right to the same freedoms, flaws and dignities as everyone else. 
I know that we are made to feel like we’re asking for too much when we refuse to settle for not enough, but we should never forget that our worth is:
-not in our complexion 
-not in our hair texture
-not in our physicality 
-not in our grammar or accents
-not in our bank account balances

We have the right to stand and fall and get back up again.

This is all very new to me. You are going to be a lot of firsts. I am still a bit awkward and I know that I have already stood on your toes, clipped your heels, and tripped over my own feet (because I pulled away too fast), but I am still excited because I have finally decided to stand up and I am now just learning to walk, so give me a little time to get the hang of this thing. It’s kind of ironic: when I am near you, there are moments when I am so nervous that I forget to breathe, and I can’t help but tense up. But when I am under stress, that very memory of your closeness relaxes me, and when I remember your head lightly touching mine, and how I felt the muscles in your face move as you smiled against my shoulder, I can breathe again—I let out every breath I ever held back all at once.
I loved spending time with you over break, and even though I'm trying really hard to be your friend...I still think about you.

I admire those who volunteer for ADOCH! We are low on Community Ambassadors and need more people to volunteer. 

As a Community Ambassador, you would connect with a small unit of prefrosh on the Sunday of ADOCH by helping lead them through a campus wide scavenger hunt along with a unit hangout. In addition, you'll serve as another point of contact for the prefrosh during ADOCH and help introduce them to what life at Brown is like.

Succulent morsels of a feathered creature.
The pure tender white
Pervades your mouth with explosions of flavor
So simple
Yet such an essence of joy and wholesomeness.
The golden jacket covers the piece beautifully.
It is as crisp as an autumn morning
As you take a bite of the treat.
The aroma is a blast of fried delight
Waiting to lure children into its
Pleasant trap
Of deliciousness.
They jump out of the oven and onto your plate,
Then into your mouth
Where they halt the growling of your stomach.
A perfect picking
To fill your hunger.
Succulent morsels of a feathered creature.
Chicken Nuggets.

If it would make you
Just say hi. 

Ceylon, Sencha,
And Darjeeling,
I don’t know how
To stop this feeling. 
Tealuxe Guy,
My heart you’re stealing,
As I dance somewhere
Near the ceiling.

Tealuxe Guy,
I’m quite frustrated
Forever strangers
We must be fated. 
My thirst, therefore,
Cannot be sated,
But at least
I’m caffeinated.

SUPPORT CAMP RYSE (Refugee Youth Solidarity through Education)! 

Camp RYSE, formerly known as BRYTE Summer Camp, is a five-week academic enrichment program for refugee youth in Providence (K-12). Our mission is to foster community, confidence, and joy among refugee youth through creative, inquiry-based learning and leadership development. Our community is built on asset-based, joyful learning; community participation and family engagement; youth leadership; and a deep commitment to creating a space for students can celebrate their identities and build friendships across common experiences of migration, resettlement, and adjustment to a new environment. 

This summer, Camp RYSE is looking to continue supporting and enrolling over 100 refugee Providence youth, while hosting our program in an accessible and air-conditioned space and expanding compensated leadership opportunities for our youth. We fundraise 100% of our budget, and would very much appreciate support (through advertising, donations, etc.) in order for Camp RYSE to be safe and successful for campers.

This community is built on doing what we can, when we can. We are forever grateful for the many ways each of you contribute. You can click here to share or donate -- you can also click here to view information about our ongoing snack drive. Thank you so much for your support.
-CAMP RYSE family

It was datamatch season. I started messaging you on Facebook, we got tea. When I met you in person you were just as cute as you looked in photos (very) but I wasn’t feeling it physically and knew immediately—I dunno, pheromones and shit, it’s whatever. So I just kinda sat there and was boring and let you direct conversation. Little did I know you were one of the coolest people I would meet this year. Seeing the look on your face as you talked about some of your passions was truly inspiring and I have since asked (and will continue to ask) quite a few girls for coffee in the hopes that they’d be something like you. Either I have bad luck or you are really fucking special because as far as I could tell none of them were even close to as cool as you. Haven’t said anything other than hi to you since, but mad respect. And your music taste is impeccable.

’twas an eve in the rock

all snug ‘round their heads
and they dreamed of the hour
they'd see their dorm beds.

When I wake up, it is not the list of the things to do today that I want to see.
When I wake up, it is the sudden message from my old friend back home that I want to see.

When I go to classes and lunch, it is not the small talk that I need to do with my friends that I want to do.
When I go to classes and lunch, it is sharing of laughter and funny stories that I want to have with my friends.

When I finish my classes, it is not the pressure to study and keep up with the good grades by the society and people that I should care.
When I finish my classes, it is a walk that I go on and the music I listen to at the park alone that I should care.

When I eat dinner, it is not the complaints of how much work we have that I want to have.
When I eat dinner, it is the catch up and how our life are going that I want to have. and maybe a little bit of complaints.

When at night, it is not the loneliness that I always want.
When at night, it is often somebody whom I can talk about everything including my shit, and my past. Both good ones and bad ones alike.

Everyday, I want somebody I can hug, and somebody I can cry on shoulder as hard as I actually want to.

Hey everyone,

There was a policy change announced in Today@Brown last night about sophomores being required to stay on meal plan.

We think that its grossly unfair to not let us have the choice or even the option to apply to be allowed off meal plan and we plan on voicing our concerns to the Office of the Dean of the College via an open letter of concern and a list of names in support. 

If anyone else is upset with the new policy and would like a change, please add your name to the google sheets and take a look at the google docs! We welcome any new ideas or changes!

We admire our right to not being broke and have food at the same time.

Here's a Google docs with the letter of concern: 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/164HcqD-Y_DEvMUeELJgnBN-P_8QP3EsKGZxq3tPKbMA/edit?usp=sharing

And here's a spreadsheet for names in support: 

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1cSBORZICXP2Y3IoGyzaO-ArR0eG717nr0JzxX6Vq2vM/edit?usp=sharing

Here's to all the international students who didn't attend an international school back in their own country. Here's to those who weren't necessarily taught by American teachers or were under an American curriculum and grew up in a schooling environment that didn't use English as a mode of instruction. Here's to those who struggle in code switching their accents into an American one so people can understand you better. Here's to those who have to repeatedly explain where your country is geographically located. Here's to those who are automatically assumed to be from a rich background, little did people know that you're under a strict scholarship whereby your GPA level is being scrutinized by your sponsor. Here's to those who feel like they're insecure among their other international peers just because they didn't attend an American/British international school. Here's to you guys. You are enough and you are loved.

It's been a long, hard four years at Brown.

Is there someone in the Class of 2020 who you've had crush on for a while, but haven't had the guts to ask out? Maybe someone from your freshman year unit or an FYS way back when? Or maybe someone you've just met recently and you've been seeing around the GCB? Well, now's your chance! Get ready for Round 1 of Brown Senior Scramble for the Class of 2020!!!! Just in time for *spooky season*.

Our team is currently planning on holding 3 more rounds throughout the school year: one towards the end of this semester, one around Valentine's Day, and one right before senior week.

It goes like this: you submit up to five names to our form. If someone who you listed also submits your name when they fill out our form, it's a match!!

Rules:
- Only members of the Class of 2020 or Class of 2020.5 can participate
- Up to 5 names can be submitted by Wednesday, October 30 at 11:59pm
- Matches will be privately emailed to both parties on Thursday, October 31
- A match DOES NOT imply any degree of sexual consent. Be respectful of your matches and seek consent just as you would in any other relationship.

Fill out the form at https://tinyurl.com/brownscramble2020-1

The turnaround is quick for this one, and the more people that fill out the form, the more likely people are to get matched!

Be sure to like our official Facebook page at https://facebook.com/brownscramble2020/ to get the most up-to-date information.

Ready, set, scramble!!

To that girl in the Sci-Li in the pineapple costume on Friday:

I was the boy wearing the pizza costume, and I think that says it all. It was love at first sight. The green foliage you wore on your head was what first attracted my attention. From there, it only got better. It’s been four days, and I still can’t stop thinking about you. I would say please notice me, but I know you noticed me looking before you glanced away quickly. Too quickly… and still, your brown eyes haunt my every dream. And whenever I do get to see them again, it really piques my pepperoni… if you know what I mean.

We have mutual friends, but I don’t think we’ve ever hung out. I know you called me crusty, and told your friends you’re not interested… but I just wish you’d give me a chance. Every time I see you with another girl or guy, I die a little bit on the inside. My sun rises and sets with you. You’re the single most beautiful person/pineapple I’ve ever seen. All I’m asking for is a chance.

Yours forever (or at least as long as you’ll have me),

Loving you was painful, it still is just in a different way. You think you're a burden or too much, even though it's absolutely untrue, so you fade away from everyone and that's where my true heartbreak lies. You are lovable inherently, it's not just because of the mask. You are not as self aware as you think, if anything, you know knowing about yourself and even less about everyone else. It's clear now you were never serious about being friends and I'm moving on but, I believe you'll find yourself I really do. I hope you find courage and I hope you find conviction. If anyone could do it, despite all the pain, it's you. You are magnificent in that way. There's far more freedom and ultimately safety, in facing the darkness than there is in hiding from it.

how do I tell m'pincus that I have been in love with her since fourth grade, 1932? I thought that a return to our collegiate campus would cure my endless pine for her. Yet, instead I continue to writhe inwardly with the pain of un-knowing her true feelings for me. ere the days shorten to whole blackness, might we meet each other again in that building where our most sacred memories were once held? fair journalist, play sweetly your coveted spotify for me as we did in the days of our youth and I will bend the world over to meet you. would that I could wallow in the shallow misery of unrequited lose rather than that endless, unshakeable doubt of the unconfessed. you know me, m'pincus, m'dearest, m'love and old friend.

ii.

My love for you I once proclaim’d
In Hopes to touch thine gentle ears;
Who thought thy beauty could be tamed?
My loneliness I drown in beers.
With certainty I see you less
Thine scarcity my days doth cloud.
Alas, I fear, one must confess
For e’en in love not all’s allowed.
He who purloins my fairest rhymes
Accustomed to your marble glow,
Forbidden fruit of careless crimes,
A drunken night he stole my flow.
Dear imposter, no skill is free,
For now: I bite my thumb at thee.

To Zil—it's okay, we know you're not an Uncrustables thief. Seriously though, I love you a lot, you're amazing human being, and I'm proud of you for getting through this hellish semester.

The days since your leaving grow in number
And yet this feeling persists
It lives in me 

I drove by your house once
Just to be close to you

My hand wonders aloud
Where yours has gone
It feels less protected
Without your interwoven fingers

I fantasize about seeing your name 
Pop up on my phone
Hey, you’d say
I made a mistake, you’d say
Can we talk?

I know it won’t happen
Every minute I spend daydreaming of 
Our reconciliation 
Or writing about it
Is another week I’ll spend
unable to move on

And I must 
It is something I must do
Move on
Because it seems as though
You already have
And now it’s just me
Mourning us
Alone

So I will mourn
And write more poems
As many as it takes
And the last leaves will fall off the trees
And one day 
It’ll all just be a memory 
I’ll forget your hands and your laugh
You’ll forget my eyes and the way they saw you
And that’s all

Sylvia Ren.

That's the post.

This post is in admiration of myself and everyone else struggling with mental illness. Thoughts can get so complicated and difficult to work through, but we worked through. We survived this year, and we’re not going anywhere. You can do this. We can do this. Find ways to laugh at the sadness. Fight back, even if you’ve been fighting for a long time, seemingly without end, even if it feels like you can’t keep fighting. You can and will survive. You will thrive, even if it seems like that is infinitely far away, even if it takes a long time to get there. You are stronger than you know.

To all you who are reading and waiting for your name to one day appear in a post, who are shrinking more and more as you scroll through pages and pages of shoutouts, never one with your name attached—I feel with you.

Please know that many someones have felt admiration for you—for your spirit, your enthusiasm when you get into the topic you love, that brilliant observation you made, for the way that you look, flush-faced and breathless as you walk into a room on a windswept day, for that feature of yours that you've always felt self conscious about, but to them, is perfectly charming. Also know that so often, these thoughts go unspoken, silenced by fear of embarrassment, fear of causing discomfort, by the moment passing, by the fact that we've all trained ourselves to let these admirations pass by. Know that just because the appreciation people feel for you is silent, does not mean that it is nonexistent.

For all you who are reading, I challenge you: let's be each other's admirers. Embrace the pleasant discomfort. Don't let all the random, mundane appreciations you feel slip away unvoiced, but share one here and there. Let's normalize a culture where showing appreciation and admiration doesn't have to be confined to an anonymous page or limited to occasions of remarkable achievement or generosity, but can be shared day-to-day, face-to-face, accompanied by a perhaps unfamiliar, but no less warm smile.

This is a BBA for anyone who's missing someone who hurt them. It's great if you can be friends with an ex but sometimes things go down so coldly that the only course is a clean break. But just because that happens, even when it's plainly the other person's fault, it doesn't mean that you won't miss them so much sometimes that it hurts your chest. With time you will heal, but someone who breaks you without remorse is already broken themselves.

I admire people who are happy inside as they look outside. Everyday I put on a facade of emotions in front of my friends/those I care about when almost every night I come back home and feel a gaping hole inside me that I try to anxiously but fail miserably to fill -- it's been food these days that I chew and spit out or swallow and throw up multiple times throughout the day. I want to be fixed. I can't find the source. Nothing happened. Or Brown happened. My entire life happened? I've been hating every moment since moving to the states as a child. Brown happened because I can't make myself trust or like a single "friend" I made here, though I pretend my best to make them feel they're my favorite people ever. I feel vulnerable here, like a chick on the ground after falling from its nest that can be crushed under an unknowing heel at any moment. I don't know how people survive in this environment. I've been away from family enough to get used to home not being home, but the more the years that accumulate in me without home I feel myself breaking. Maybe I just want the attention, just for one person to notice I'm not the bubbly, hyper, happy-go-lucky girl I portray everyday. I don't want to die. I just want this kind of life to end. And a life without Brown is a broken pause button, no better than death. I say I wanna be fixed but do I There are no wants inmy life. There are only needs. I need to be fixed but I don't know how to want that for myself. I don't know how to want the best for myself rather than need it.

It's time for SENIOR SCRAMBLE ROUND 2!!

Is there someone in the Class of 2020 who you've had crush on for a while, but haven't had the guts to ask out? Maybe someone from your freshman year unit or an FYS way back when? Or maybe someone you've just met recently and you've been seeing around the GCB? Well, now's your chance! Get ready for Round 2 of Brown Senior Scramble for the Class of 2020!!!! Just in time for Valentine's Day!

Our team is currently planning on holding one more round of senior scramble after this one, right before senior week.

It goes like this: you submit up to five names to our form. If someone who you listed also submits your name when they fill out our form, it's a match!!

Rules:
- Only members of the Class of 2020 or Class of 2020.5 can participate
- Up to 5 names can be submitted by Thursday, February 13 at 11:59pm
- Matches will be privately emailed to both parties on Friday, February 14
- A match DOES NOT imply any degree of sexual consent. Be respectful of your matches and seek consent just as you would in any other relationship.
- Any questions should be emailed to brownscramble2020@gmail.com

Fill out the form at https://tinyurl.com/brownscramble2020-2

Make sure to like our page at https://www.facebook.com/brownscramble2020/ for all the latest info.

The turnaround is quick, and the more people that fill out the form, the more likely people are to get matched!

Ready, set, scramble!!

People go to Brown for a variety of reasons. For some it’s to answer fundamental questions about the theory of everything–quantum mechanics. To others, it’s to answer that age old question of do I have free will? And to many, it’s how do I make big bucks and do good in the world simultaneously? But for me it’s something else. To me it’s to ask two questions central to how the world works. (1) is Maia Chiu single. And (2) how does one get to know her?? 👀 for reals tho

- the space in between -
There's so much that I cannot say
So much that I cannot bring myself to put into words
To put into air
To put into the world
When after they have been set free then they cannot be caught back and hidden away again
Before they cross the space in between us.
But if I could
Set down lyrics to these thoughts and snippets
I would write the colors of your summer dresses
Sing the arc of your lashes and the waves of your hair
Somehow describe all that you mean to me.
But my words aren't enough.
I can't capture the echoes of your voice in my heart long after it's faded from my ears
Or the way I remember any of the other moments
That likely never meant so much to you.
Still
If I were to make an attempt,
Put words on paper and try to sift my fears and doubts from the space in between
I think that all that would remain is
I love you.

To Mariya Gedrich

I know it’s really hard for people to put themselves out there, especially if they are not yet sure about their feelings yet, so I’m just writing this to show that directly telling the person who you like may work better sometimes. I personally prefer people to just tell me if they like me or not. I’m a rather diffident person so the hints often just confused me or made me think there wasn’t enough sincerity. Honestly if someone just tell me directly that he or she likes me (for sure after having been hanging out for a while), the chance that I say yes would have been higher

SENIOR SCRAMBLE ROUND 3 - ""UNDERGRAD OMELETTE""

Hi everyone, due to the possibility that Brown students might be going home at some point later in the semester, the senior scramble team has decided to hold an additional round of senior scramble! If classes are cancelled, this will be our final round of senior scramble. If they are not cancelled, then we'll still have the additional round right before senior week.

There is one TWIST with this round: we've gotten countless requests to have a round of senior scramble that allows seniors to match with students who are not seniors, and other requests for underclassmen to be included in the pool for the matching process. Thus, we've decided to call Round 3 of Senior Scramble the ""Undergrad Omelette"", where all undergrad students can participate.

Rules:
- All undergrad Brown students can participate, and can put down the name of a Brown student in any class year
- Up to 5 names can be submitted by Saturday, March 14 at 11:59pm
- Matches will be privately emailed to both parties on Sunday, March 15
- A match DOES NOT imply any degree of sexual consent. Be respectful of your matches and seek consent just as you would in any other relationship.
- Any questions should be emailed to brownscramble2020@gmail.com

Fill out the form at https://tinyurl.com/brownscramble2020-3

Ready, set, scramble!

Geo Lee, with all of the chaos in the world rn, I wish I could take you away from all of its stress and danger. Unfortunately, due to quarantine and all, I can’t do so, at least not physically. However, I’ve set up a Minecraft world for the two of us to live in, together, if you would join me. I’ve spent my spring break thus far reaping the land for materials to build us not just a house that is safe, but a home that brings comfort. I can’t promise you much, for I am but a simple minecrafter, but I could provide you with as much bread and cobblestone as your heart desires. I’ve even been saving up my resources and going without much needed tools just so one day I could give you a horse with diamond armor, maybe as an anniversary present? 😉
I know this is a lot to ask, and it’s probably happening pretty quickly, so I don’t want to rush you, I’ve built an annex tower to my Minecraft lodge where you can put your bed and set your spawn until you’re ready to move in completely (which I hope would be soon 🥺). So, will you escape with me? 🥰

Let's talk about Rachel guys. It is crazy being at home because I can't hear the sound of her laughing literally all the time. Rachel is always so happy and and excited for any challenge. She works insanely hard (premed CS is an absurd way of life) and never takes her stress out on any of her friends. Her beautiful silliness has lead to umbrella fights, bottles of gatorade flying through Jo's, and countless infectious giggles every time Ben trips over a curb. Speaking of Ben, did you all know that Rachel is a piano virtuoso and we missed getting to see their duet on campus by a matter of days? These two were the absolute highlights of their last concert I went to with like 20 people in it, and they get along so well together. My guess is that together they could make some absolutely gorgeous music. 
Rachel is also incredibly kind. She always checks in on her friends, and she is so pretty in all of her pastel dresses. We should all appreciate the wonder that is Rachel Ma.

Aryana javaheri: We may not agree on every single aspect of grading options, but I admire your passion in standing up for yourself and our ability to choose 💙

You're still in Providence, or so I believe anyway. I am also in Providence still, but you know that already. (After all, where else would I be?)

We were close. But we haven't talked at all this spring semester. That's because you've made it abundantly clear, since the winter break, that you don't want to talk to me.

I still don't know what happened.

It's ok. You've hurt me before. I reacted badly and hurt you even more. We made up for a semester, and now you're hurting me again. But that's ok.

There is so much I want to tell you, but I won't.

After the summer, I'll (hopefully) be gone from Providence. For good. In all likelihood we'll never cross paths ever again.

Strangely, I'm happy for you. You implicitly told me to f off. That's the first time I see you stand up for yourself. Although, I wish you had the strength to tell me explicitly, and tell me why.

You won't have to, of course. Because I won't reach out again.

Goodbye.

Yours lovingly,

Dear Blueno Bears, I write to you today to express my admiration for Lizzy Wang of the computer science department at Brown. I write because I have not meet a more motivated, kind, and wonderful person. I truly admire how dedicated she is to her work, particularly when it comes to her HTA positions. I consider myself beyond lucky to call her a friend and to say that we are close.
Beyond that, Lizzy has a beautiful smile that always illuminates my day which accompanies a sincere kindness and generosity which one can only admire and respect. I do not know if she will see this nor if you will post this, yet I hope it does find a way to her - more than anything to let her know that someone appreciates her for who she is.

Alex Walsh:
You are an amazing leader, songwriter, thinker, and mathematician, and I am so glad that you are going to teach next year, because I wish I had more teachers like you when I was in middle school. You create kind and fun communities and make everyone in them happier because you are around. 
Here’s the short and the long of it:
Just about everyone in math DUG wants to be you, be with you, or both. Last week you had minimum 3 people jealous of a pilot in Hawaii’s middle school years, and everyone else was terribly jealous of you. How many math concentrators actually had a life in middle school?
You have this wonderful way of going through the world, brightening every room you enter, and I hope that after you graduate I can still occasionally be in them.

You know that kind of love where you look into your partner's eyes and see your future play out? It's like you're shaking hands with their soul, having a silent conversation about an uncertain future that seems to solidify itself with each passing moment. Then you blink and remember the carnal reality in which you exist.
Shout out to Professor Pollock for asking people what they needed and then prioritizing the needs his students.

I feel like myself when I’m with you. In fact, I feel more myself with you than I do anyone else, or even when I’m alone. Or maybe it’d be more accurate to say that when I’m with you, I feel like I’m creating myself in the way a sculptor carves meaning from clay: it’s shaky, uncertain, unplanned, and yet I’m closer to becoming the kind of person I want to be than I’ve ever been before. It’s crazy, how you give me the courage to do that; you fill me with a bravery I couldn’t find on my own. I’ve never told you I feel (although probably, you already know and you’re too polite to mention it), and in any case, you’d never feel the same way. That’s alright by me, I’m grateful enough to be your friend. I just wish that I could tell you how important you are. To me, and to everyone who knows you. You’re an incredible person and I miss you. Sometimes I think that now we’re so far apart (almost 10,000 miles!), that you’ll start to forget about me – that I’m already fading from your thoughts, and this terrifies me. Sorry this is so messy. It’s late where I am, and I can’t stop thinking about you. I can’t wait to be in your presence again.

We're not okay. We will never be okay again, but damn, I will never not love you. You will probably never see this, but I will, and it'll remind me that you and I had a chance, to work things out, to cry, to apologize to each other and make up, to catch up over boba and to hug and cry again. But I didn't, and neither did you. And now, I can't even bear to see you. When I see you in passing, I can barely muster a smile and an exhausted "How've you been?" and listen intently as you tell me about classes or meetings, when really I want to know how you've been, without our friendship. Without us cuddling to sleep or watching dumb TV or eating spicy food until we set our mouths on fire. How have you been, really, because I haven't been, at all. You only exist in our pictures, our old texts, our memories now. I wish things were different, just with you, God, I wish. But they aren't, they probably never will be, so I'll just wish you the best and hope to God you're happy forever and then some. I hope you've been well. I love you.

This BBA is for everyone involved in teaching CS22 (HTAs, UTAs, Professor, all of them). Thank you for genuinely caring about us students and being there for us. Your dedication is not going unnoticed!

You told me that one day in April, we'd be sitting in the grass under the sun and that we'd be happy. Your promise got me through the winter. Whenever I was too cold and too sad to leave my room, I'd visit our day in spring.

It's April now. It just snowed last night. It's been weeks since I've left the house. It's been months since I've really been your friend.

But I'm happy right now. And I hope that you are too.

I am sitting by myself alone contemplating about the joy that was stripped from my life after the lockdown. I remember the days when I would walk by blueno and laugh at how ugly it is. I remember the times I would stop on the main green between classes and entertain my eyes with its beauty. I remember times I see a beloved one passing by and talk with them for 20 minutes and show up late for my class. I remember the happiness and livelihood in my heart when I am being called across thayer. I remember the excitement when everyone is talking about that fish dish at the ratty or the special new dessert. I remember the long lines for the omlette and how I would rather stay hungry than to wait. I remember Gail's warm smile when she swipes my card. I remember the nice kids at Brown who will help you without knowing who you are. I remember my stressful times and all the people who helped me. I remember the empathy my professors showed towards me. I remember the basement of the sci li and I wish to forget that. I remember the sunlab and how it stings. I remember the chem labs and how useless they are. I remember I hated that life. I remember it was boring. I remember I was miserable. I wish I remembered to pause and appreciate its beauty. I wish to remember the nice things in my life. I wish I continue to remember my gratitude to these days. I wish to remember to live the beauty in my everyday. I wish to get back to that life.

I don't know who needs this right now, but thank you for being you and being in my life. Sorry, if I haven't been able to keep in touch with you recently. This situation is hard for everyone in one way or another, and I just haven't been able to reach out as much as I want to. It's not that you aren't a priority. I've just been struggling too. I'd also appreciate it if you reached out first, but I understand if you can't. Just know that even if there isn't any communication at the moment, I still care about you deeply, and I can't wait for the day I see you again. Stay strong. We'll get through this. I love you.

I've tutored over 70 different students over my time at Brown, and honestly I have never been more fulfilled by a job/activity/group of people in my life. I am truly in awe of what Brown students continue to accomplish every day, and I'm so grateful to have had the opportunity to get to know many of you personally via the tutoring program. As a graduating senior, this experience has definitely had a lasting impact on me, and I will continue to cherish the mentoring I've gotten to do through it. To my students--you all are rockstars, and I'm proud to have worked with every single one of you. And to other students--I highly encourage you to get involved in the group tutoring program in any which way you can. You won't regret it!

Shout out to me: it took my entire time at Brown but I have finally had a full semester without any serious suicidal ideation or actions. Goodnight microbes everywhere

You better read this because this is the most honest I’ll ever be able to be with you, and there’s a reason I chose today of all days to do this. And you’re probably laughing that I’m writing this here of all places. 
Used to love you and used to think you understand me, but now when you do things without realising or even thinking about how they make me feel I realise how wrong I was all along. I understand why you do what you do, and I’m never going to ask you to change anything for me because that’s not my place anymore. But this makes it so hard for me to move past what happened and see you the way I used to. I still love you though, although not in the same way as before. It’s the kind of way where hearing about you doing something good or getting something you wanted makes me feel warm and glow up for you inside. The kind of way in which if you’re doing something that might get you hurt I’ll worry about you. But I won’t ever tell you that, because I’m scared of trusting you with anything I feel. I want you to be happy in every possible way, even about the thing that sometimes makes me sting with bitterness. I want to trust you again and see your face and hear your voice and watch your name light up my screen and not feel my heart sink and my body tense up because I’m suddenly (even if momentarily) reminded of how it felt to sit numbly as you chose to not choose me a little more everyday, and blamed myself for it. 
But I care about you, and think about you, and often when something exciting happens whether it’s a new person I’m flirting with or a new thing my dog does or a fight I have with my family you’re the first person I want to talk to. But I can’t, because it hurts, and I would rather love you from afar than hate you all the time. 
If you’re wondering what this is about or if it’s about you, this probably doesn’t concern you.

Shoutout to the best game ever invented. I’m not gonna say what it is bc I’ve already revealed too much and people will know who I am. We must uphold the A in BBA. My great grandmother played it, and now i do too. It’s literally like crack. I play 9+ hours a day literally every day, and I’m never bored. I can read a book on theory in this game like it’s the vampire saga that my sister loved as a teen. Each class this year, I played nonstop. Took 0 notes. Grades weren’t amazing but it’s ok bc I fucking rock at this game. My best friend now knows whether I’m playing or not bc he figured out what my finger movement on the mousepad when playing this game looks like while watching lecture capture every day. Later, We were in like a pretty important meeting, he was not in view of my screen, yet I got a text from him that said “stop playing ___ and focus” love this game. Jesus I got to stop drinking before I write these. ❤️

Shit I just realized that the A in BBA does not stand for anonymous, it stands for admirers. Sorry for the mistake. Also my sister texted me back, it’s called the twighlight saga definitely spelled that wrong

My boyfriend doesn’t like attention, so I won’t make it clear who he is, but I just want to tell all of you how much I admire him. 
He is so funny and handsome and levelheaded and even though he doesn’t like it when I tell him he’s smart, he is just unbelievably gifted. It can be hard to believe how much easier he finds his work than anyone I’ve ever met and how hard he works anyway. He could skate by on his insane abilities but he never has, and I don’t think he ever will. 
The thing I admire most about him is the care that he gives me. He is always there for me when I need him (which is a lot) and his advice is perfect, even when I don’t want to hear it. He remembers every detail from every story I tell, and he watches comedies with me because he knows I can’t handle scary movies during Covid. He talks to me every day. I can’t wait to see him again.

This is a BBA for Cameron Tripp. Not only does he have the 12th sexiest accent according to big 7 travel.com but he deduced who really wrote the most recent Nick Scott BBA. I mean I think we all have imposter syndrome sometimes, but this level of Herculean deduction must be divine in nature, because no mere mortal could figure such a puzzler out. Now for the main topic of discussion, heart this message if you dream of opening up a D&D B&B (yes a dungeons and dragons Bed and breakfast) with nick Scott in Lancaster Pennsylvania in the heart of Amish country where we make hot scones each morning for the guests and our adopted children play Football Golf (a sport i invented) in the backyard with the 2 dogs. You also get a gift bag when you leave with a quilt (hand crocheted by me) detailing your time at the “Scott and Gold together, growing old together inn” as well as a giftcard to the tanger outlets off of route 30 (look it up) banana republic. You guys have no idea how often I make hypothetical scenarios of nick and I starting businesses together, like the 2 Jews with a brew coffee and bagel shop, where we sell the best Lox Spread Bagel in Essox county New Jersey according to SOMA (also look it up I do my research). Look a BBA about someone else became about nick this is crazy shit man

These are most of the Nick Scott business ideas

Coffee Shop: “2 Jews with a Brew”

D&D themed bed and breakfast: “The Scott and Gold together, Growing old together inn”

Bridge Club: “Bridge For Everyone, With Scott Gold Fun!”

Laser Tag Arcade: “Have a Shot at Gloryium fun Emporium”

Butcher shop: Scott and Gold’s Neighborhood Meats

Casino: “The GOLDen NICKet”

Our Law firm “Scott, Gold et al” with the tagline “We’ll win you your weight in Gold, right in the Nick of time”

24/7 Rap Record/farming equipment store: “Gold and Scott’s Hip Hop Mom and Pop Shop, your non stop around the clock from the flop to the top place for all your crops and beat drops”

expired ice store that’s always completely out of expired ice: “Scott and Gold’s 7 day old rotten cold with lots of mold but already sold ice store”

Polly I want you to know how much I love you and how much you mean to me. Even before we were together, you were the single most influential person in my life, and I’m glad to have you both as my best friend and my girlfriend, just a dream come true. There isn’t anyone in the world who’s as caring, loving, motivated, keeping, trusting, understanding, respecting, compassionate and amazing at everything that they do other than you. You doubt yourself, while doing stuff that most people can only aspire to do, and I look up to you, and wanna do as much as I can to push you to achieve more and more in life. You have been there for me when I’ve needed you and even when I haven’t, cause you just care so much. Even in this Pandemic, you would work your ass off in the day and talk to me the whole night because of our time difference, without saying a word even when it was an inconvenience for you because of your parents. We’ve made it here, but not without you sacrificing your sleep, and doing so much more, cause you love me so much, and cause you care. It’s been so long but I don’t know how we can still talk for hours on end, each day, yet still never get bored. We can’t even finish watching a single movie in a week cause we just don’t wanna stop talking to each other, and even when we try we end up just staring in each other’s eyes. This is all because you’re the most perfect human being, you complete my existence, and I just can’t imagine my life without you. When I’m busy as hell, I still wanna talk to you, stay in the call and take my meetings, or just do something so I can see your most beautiful and pretty face, and somehow split my brains screen in half so I can always see you no matter what I’m doing, because you are what drives me, motivates me to do anything. I can’t wait to see you, and I know we miss each other so much that we might just tear up when we meet, but it’s been so long and I can’t wait for us to be in each others arms again, love you to infinity ❤️

I really am so grateful for my boyfriend. He is coming to visit me in two weeks and I am so excited. He has been so patient with me throughout all the craziness. He writes me embarrassing poems and is my number one fan. I am so proud of him and all the work he does. I truly feel blessed to be with him. Can't wait to order Thai food and watch Naruto with him.

To further shores, my love, you’ve gone anew
And in your space you’ve left a vacant wind
In opéra you played an ingénue
With blushing cheeks and timbre tamarind

Of this remember I from time to time
Between my daily walks from a to b
I think of you in prose and in a Rime
But unlike Mariners, in calmer sea

But you had passion for a bearded man
Whose hands you cuddled into when distressed
The man in question galloped to Iran
And put his sultry digits to my breast

Impermeable are my feelings though
I want you even though you love him so

And natural wholesomeness suffice

This is a BBA to myself. In reference to 17386, Facebook wouldn’t let me comment the picture of what my bridge partner sent me that day. I haven’t thought about that moment in like two years, but it was probably the most embarrassing moment of my life, but I did not let that idiot deter me. After what was probably my fourth or fifth week at competitive bridge, I had a partner who Screamed at me that I was a fucking idiot and Would never be good at the game in front of everyone at the bridge club. He then sent me an email saying , “read a book on bidding, and stop your thinking that you know how to bid. That display today was pitiful. Nobody I know plays this way. If your Play doesn’t get to some resemblance of order, you will lose future partners. Today was a complete waste of time. This man was screaming at a 17-year-old kid who literally thought this mentor was the best bridge player ever. My great grandmother played back in the day and I felt like I was dishonoring her by being so bad at the game. Flash forward to now, and I am the best player at my school, consistently place very high in tournaments with world-class players, and am more in love with the game than I ever have been. I’m freakin amazing, and Gordy had no goddamn idea what he was talking about.

My boyfriend doesn’t like attention, so I won’t make it clear who he is, but I just want to tell all of you how much I admire him. 
He is so funny and handsome and levelheaded and even though he doesn’t like it when I tell him he’s smart, he is just unbelievably gifted. It can be hard to believe how much easier he finds his work than anyone I’ve ever met and how hard he works anyway. He could skate by on his insane abilities but he never has, and I don’t think he ever will. 
The thing I admire most about him is the care that he gives me. He is always there for me when I need him (which is a lot) and his advice is perfect, even when I don’t want to hear it. He remembers every detail from every story I tell, and he watches comedies with me because he knows I can’t handle scary movies during Covid. He talks to me every day. I can’t wait to see him again.

To all the upperclassmen who feel lonely at Brown, myself included: you are not alone, and you are worthy of friendships and love and all the good things that constitute humanity. Your time at Brown is not over yet, and no matter how many months you have left, ahead of you are still morsels of kindness and human connections to be found and savored. Around the corner, there are always friends to be made, so please open up your heart to love and to be loved -- because, trust me, you really do deserve it.
If you haven’t already, please vote!!!

to everyone else who's looking to the future and seeing no hope: 

i love you. i'm sorry the people who came before us have broken their promise of a future that will get better. i know it's hard. i love you. i know we're all doing our best. i know that most of us will leave Brown knowing that things have to change, and that even if the change looks huge and insurmountable, there will be enough of us to chip away at it however we can. 

and even if we can't destroy it all, we will leave less behind for the people -- or perhaps, whatever life is born from our ruins -- to clean up, to suffer with. if nothing else, we can leave behind an earth that's trying to heal. if nothing else, we can be people who are trying to heal. 

i love you. i know you're doing your best. i'm sorry. i love you. i love you. i love you.

It’s late, but I miss you all. I spent a good part of my early teenage years dreaming of idealistic love that would sweep me off my feet, the passionate, breathless, overwhelming kind. Then I had my heart broken, many times, and I began to think that the only kind of love worth anything, would be the one that would come along when I was older- the boring, sustainable kind, the kind you find when you’re thirty and looking to settle down. 
You trudged in, slow and steady, breaking down walls, fighting all my attempts to push you away. I was terrified at how easy it was, terrified that this wasn’t the passion I secretly craved, terrified that I would find the sustainable ten years earlier than I planned. But you walked in through the door, grabbed me in your arms, and took my breath away. Like you have every day ever since. With you I find sustainability in passion, contentment in monotony, and a completeness I never imagined was possible at this very confused stage of my 21 year old life. 
I don’t know what will happen to us and where life will take us. I know that if I could choose my life right now, I would pick growing old by your side in a heartbeat over every crowning academic and professional glory I could choose to have. But, that’s irrelevant. Regardless of the future, I am so supremely grateful to you for showing me how happiness should feel, how being valued, and respected, and loved can go hand in hand with passion, (how sometimes that can mean binge watching New Girl instead of having sex) and how taking that leap of faith for love is always worth it. If not for now, if not for this, for what now and this will mean for the future. 
Word of advice from a reasonably well-experienced senior: Take the leap, kids. It works out sometimes, and when it doesn’t, it takes you closer to a time it will work out.

CS19 TA appreciation 1/15: Thomas

Thomas, thank you so much for being an incredible HTA this semester! You know absolutely everything, and you helped us answer our own questions by gently nudging us towards the right answer in hours and on Campuswire (and seriously, you’re the best Campuswire responder ever! Absolutely unfailingly helpful, no matter how tangential the question might have been). You have taken many of us who were nervous and panicked about our code and made us feel a whole lot better coming out of your hours with your undying belief in our braincells’ abilities. We see how much work you have put into the course, and it is well appreciated. 10/10 cheerful, 10/10 helpful, 10/10 will mercilessly kill you in electrical with the same positive attitude.

CS19 TA appreciation 2/15: Max

Max, you were an amazing HTA this semester, and the backbone of 11 am lecture (not to mention a running king!). You have a super in-depth knowledge about the subject material and were super nice about answering any and all questions we may have had, sometimes multiple times just to make sure we really got it. There were times where you sat with us for nearly thirty minutes to help us on more difficult implementations, and you were always so patient and encouraging and gently nudged us away from bad code practices. Also, one of us distinctly recalls a time where they attended your 7 am hours while you were eating cornflakes, and we think that that’s gold just on its own. You’re so appreciated, and this course was a success largely because of you!

Sincerely, 
CS19 students :)

You are also an amazing lab TA, and the ~30 minute conversations after labs were much enjoyed :) Also, thank you for being such a wonderful, fun-loving mentor; you are so approachable and easy to talk to, and the non-males in the class also had so much fun playing skribbl/codenames with you. Thank you for everything this semester!

CS19 Shriram appreciation

Shriram, you are absolutely god-tier. Thank you for making our intro CS class at Brown an enjoyable and overall encouraging experience. You are such a wholesome human being and a great lecturer, but more than that, we really appreciate you as a mentor. From the beginning of placement, you tried to make us more independent and aware of the fact that we now have our own responsibilities and must be cognizant of our actions, both as students and as future contributors to society. Now, at the tail end of the class, we are walking away with more than an understanding of how to program; we understand why the skills we picked up matter, and more importantly, how to ethically be using those skills in the context of today’s world. We are absolutely floored with the amount of effort you put into transitioning this course into an online format, being super open to feedback, and still covering a wide breadth of topics. If we were given the opportunity, nearly all of us would take 19 again in a heartbeat; your enthusiasm is that infectious. Now for some easter eggs: 

Do you know how to write in Pitman shorthand? 

What’s the difference between (-: and <-; ? Are there any other emojis that you save for 173? Why are they “backwards?”

Humor: students 37 and 52 not caught, overall strong joke suite; high-check
Smilies: mystifying, ominous, yet inviting; solid <-;
Ability to make me desire spending 4 hours catching a single chaff: check+
How much you will be missed: fun how-much-missed() -> Number: 1 + how-much-missed() end

Needless to say, many of us are sad that this class is ending, but glad that we have all the memories and funny Campuswire posts to take with us. Thank you SO much. 

Sincerely, 
CS19 students :)

Jordan- 
Two years ago you wrote a BBA asking if I was single,
I thought it was my friend’s joke but still said yes and ready to mingle. 
Our first date at blue state made my heart tingle
And my eyes twinkle.

At home my family asked what’s up with all that giggles, 
You see, 12 hours of time difference did not make our feelings dwindle.
You learned my language and we are now kinda trilingual.

Now you like to read your kindle,
With me on your side and our cats in the middle. 

Oh life is simple, 
And your little surprises add all the sprinkles. 

It’s Valentine’s Day again and this time I’ve turned the table:
Me writing you a BBA while you are eating a bagel.
